intro: Cephaelis tinctoria, commonly known as the Indian balm or blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. It is also valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects. Cephaelis tinctoria is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant floral display.
